abstract: Proponents of Texas abortion law, focus of first Supreme Court abortion case in almost decade, argue state law is intended to protect health of women who have abortions by ensuring access to emergency treatment; officials from many mainstream health care organizations in United States say measure is unnecessary and could harm patients.
lead_paragraph: Health groups, including the American Medical Association and the Texas Hospital Association, argue stringent rules the measure would impose are unnecessary.

headline.main: Better Care or Onerous Restrictions? Texas Abortion Law Going Before Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Backers of Texas Abortion Law Cite Safety, but Opponents Find It Onerous

snippet: Health groups, including the American Medical Association and the Texas Hospital Association, argue stringent rules the measure would impose are unnecessary.
